messages.ssml: <speak>The Center for Disease Control and Prevention reports that it is not yet known whether weather and temperature impact the spread of <sub alias="covid 19">COVID-19</sub>. Some other viruses, like the common cold and flu, spread more during cold weather months but that does not mean it is impossible to become sick with these viruses during other months. At this time, it is not known whether the spread of <sub alias="covid 19">COVID-19</sub> will decrease when weather becomes warmer. There is much more to learn about the transmissibility, severity, and other features associated with <sub alias="covid 19">COVID-19</sub> and investigations are ongoing.</speak>

messages.speech: The Center for Disease Control and Prevention reports that it is not yet known whether weather and temperature impact the spread of COVID-19. There is much more to learn about the transmissibility, severity, and other features associated with COVID-19 and investigations are ongoing.
